text: A solution is prepared by adding 2g of glucose into 18 g of water. Calculate the mass percent of the glucose.

The molarity of pure water is  <math display="block"> <mrow> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mi>H</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msub> <mi>O</mi> </mrow> </msub> <mo>=</mo> <mn>1</mn> <mi>g</mi> <mo>/</mo> <mi>m</mi> <mi>L</mi> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> </math> a) 50 M b) 18 M c) 55.6 M d) 100 M Key: c
